lines.text: Good morning, General. Did you see a little guy that you can't see?
[last lines]

[Pete is in a cell, trapped in a straitjacket]
I ain't crazy. You know I ain't crazy! Go tell the general that I ain't crazy.
Do you think *I'm* crazy?

[catching Donald painting a cannon in rainbow colors]
What are you doing here?
I'm a camouflage painter.
Camouflage?
[Sees the rainbow colors Donald painted on the cannon]
Why, you fool! You got to paint it so you can't see it!

[subdued]
Ohhh... I didn't know.
Get some new paint, and make that gun hard to see!
Yes, sir. Oh, why don't somebody tell me these things?

[Reading sign]
"Experimental Laboratory, Camouflage Corps. Keep out"
[Goes in]
It didn't say "positively."
[Pete notices the cannon supposedly missing, when Donald simply painted it invisible]

[shocked]
The cannon! It's gone! A fifth columnist! He stole our cannon!
[the General catches Sgt. Pete throwing grenades everywhere, trying to blow up the invisible Donald]
Just a minute, man!
He can't make a fool outta me!
Do you mean the little man you can't see?
Yeah, yeah! He's around here skipping rope. I'll get him!
